page.title: 09DOGMERSFIELD CHURCH
page.content: Early Victorian building in walled graveyard, memorials were transferred from previous church in Dogmersfield Park. One to right of font is by famed sculptor Nollekins.Gates with light are modern memorials.Views of village are depicted on 2 handstitched kneelers at the altar rail and names of residents are listed alongside. The benefice is united with Winchfield and Hartley Wintney but has its own PCC and Deanery Synod representatives. Services are held fortnightly alternating between family service with a congregational music group, and 1662 communion with an organist. A fellowship group meets on Mondays for Bible study.There are occasional flower festivals and other activities within the benefice.At the moment there is a dispute about access to the church hall.
